channel.title: Need help! NPCHandler error!
channel.description:
Hey I need help figuring out my error. I've tried everything I could and still nothing. Any help would be greatly appreciated!
[code]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError Caused by: java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: " 2834" at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source) at server.model.npcs.NPCHandler.loadAutoSpawn(NPCHandler.java:4103) at server.model.npcs.NPCHandler.<init>(NPCHandler.java:37) at server.Server.<clinit>(Server.java:69) Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

item.title: Need help! NPCHandler error!
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“burtonjon4, post:1, topic:541980”]Hey I need help figuring out my error. I’ve tried everything I could and still nothing. Any help would be greatly appreciated!

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError Caused by: java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: " 2834" at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source) at server.model.npcs.NPCHandler.loadAutoSpawn(NPCHandler.java:4103) at server.model.npcs.NPCHandler.<init>(NPCHandler.java:37) at server.Server.<clinit>(Server.java:69) Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]
Assuming you changed nothing in your NPCHandler, you didnt add the code correctly in your .cfg file. or whereever it is stored in a PI.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help! NPCHandler error!
item.dc:creator: @xX4m4zingXx xX4m4zingXx
item.description:
@xX4m4zingXx wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:5, topic:541980”][quote author=xX4m4zingXx link=topic=660852.msg4418477#msg4418477 date=1397161553]

You can always call String#trim before trying to parse it.

do you think he understand that?
(i don’t :P)
[/quote]Before you parse it, do yourStringName.trim(). It will remove trailing white spaces etc.[/quote]
That’s better

Read full topic

[/quote]
do you think he understand that?
(i don’t :P)[/quote]Before you parse it, do yourStringName.trim(). It will remove trailing white spaces etc.
